results.title: Notget
results.brief_description: The work traveled as part of the BJORK DIGITAL Exhibition. In the exhibition it is presented as and Oculus Rift experience, and is recorded as a animated VR piece for youtube and online.

results.title: Notes on the Port of St. Francis
results.brief_description: A cinematic “poem” that straddles documentary and experimental traditions capturing the atmosphere of San Francisco. Shows fresh and unexpected scenes of the city and its people in addition to San Francisco’s landmarks. The narration, spoken by Vincent Price, is taken from a descriptive essay on San Francisco written in 1882 by Robert Louis Stevenson.

results.title: Notes on the passage of time
results.brief_description: A three colour separation study filmed at Pearl Beach, which examines the same scene of Amethyst Avenue during the progression of a winter, then a summer day. With the sea in the background, the moving objects such as the pedestrians, cyclists, traffic are transparent and ephemeral while the stationary objects are opaque and retain a permanent quality. A strange, almost surreal quality illustrating the transitional nature of life.

results.title: Notes on nuclear war
results.creator_credit: Tina Viljoen, Michael Bryans and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War”.
This film follows the development of the nuclear arms race from Hiroshima to the nuclear stalemate of today. It examines the Western military-industrial complex and its Warsaw Pact counterpart, and explains how the concept of “limited” nuclear war came to be. Notes on Nuclear War shows the devastating effect of nuclear bombs; American and Soviet physicians describe the medical consequences and the inability of their profession to cope with the casualties. Part six of the seven-part series War, hosted by Gwynne Dyer, examining the nature, evolution and consequences of modern warfare.

results.title: Notes on a triangle
results.brief_description: In this short animation film the triangle achieves the distinction of principal dancer in a geometric ballet. The triangle is shown splitting into some three hundred transformations, dividing and sub-dividing with grace and symmetry to the music of a waltz. The film’s artist and animator is Rene Jodoin, whose credits include Dance Squared and several collaborations with Norman McLaren. Film without words.

results.title: Notes on a harpsichord
results.creator_credit: John Read, David Cheshire and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Craftsman”.
Follows a harpsichord from its construction to a concert performance. Philip Ledger, who is Musical Director of the Aldeburgh Festival and is one of Britain’s finest continuo players, describes the basic features of the harpsichord, and introduces the man who maintains and tunes his own harpsichord for concert performance - Malcolm Russell.

results.title: Notes for a film about Donna and Gail
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Don Owen
results.brief_description: The story of two young women who go to the city to work in a dress factory, and who share a room to ease their expenses and their loneliness. The film shows the currents that brought them together and the facets of their natures that first made them seem compatible but eventually drove them apart. Their story reflects, to a degree, the situation of anyone who has ever shared the life of another.

results.title: Not worth worrying about
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” I found a mass at the top of my breast. My doctor assured me it was nothing to worry about, I trusted his opinion.”

results.title: Not without sight
results.creator_credit: Joshua Aronson, American Foundation for the Blind and Arthur Zigouras
results.brief_description: Uses the example of four people with different kind of eye trouble in order to show the main courses of visual impairment and to show how these impairments affect sight.
